articles.title: Japan Urged to Approach Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army from Proper Stand
articles.content:
Japan Urged to Approach Issue of Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army from Proper Stand
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- It was reported that Japanese Prime Minister Abe agreed to accelerate the negotiations for the "earlier settlement of the issue of the comfort women for the Imperial Japanese Army" at talks with the south Korean chief executive in Seoul recently.
					 The news triggered off indignation of the victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army residing in the DPRK and voices of denunciation from victims of various countries in Asia and from relevant organizations.
					
					 A spokesman for the Korean Committee on Measures for the Sexual Slavery for Japanese Army and Drafting Victims in a statement Friday called on the Japanese authorities to approach the issue from a sincere and responsible stand to be understandable to all the victims around the world, instead of working hard to evade the historical and state responsibility for the issue.
					
					 The statement went on:
					
					 A lot of victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army are alive not only in the DPRK, China, the Philippines, Indonesia and other victimized Asian countries but also in the Netherlands. They strongly demand the Japanese government make proper apology and reparation for the sexual slavery and take steps for their reinstatement.
					
					 The issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, international crime against humanity, is not a bargaining chip for serving political interests nor is it an issue for Japan to gloss it over by coaxing the south Korean authorities alone.
					
					 In order to seek a proper solution to the issue the assailant Japan should admit state and legal responsibilities for all the crimes committed by it, make sincere apology and reparation to all the victims and their bereaved families in various countries and regions and give assurances to the international community against the recurrence of the crimes through the proper education in history and other practical actions.
					
					 The sexual slavery issue has become an international issue whose solution is urgent for putting an end to sexual violence and establishing universally accepted value of human rights.
					
					 This is clearly proved by the fact that recommendations and resolutions demanding the fair solution to the issue have been adopted by international organizations including the UN Human Rights Council and parliaments of various countries of the world and statues symbolic of the victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army have been erected one after another.
					
					 The Japanese authorities should be well aware of the fact that only when it takes measures from a sincere and responsible stand on all the crimes against humanity committed by it in the past including the sexual slavery, can it build true relations of trust with the international community and make contribution to regional harmony and stability.

articles.title: 46th Sports Contest of Artistes Held
articles.content:
46th Sports Contest of Artistes Held 
Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The 46th sports contest of artistes took place at the Kim Il Sung Stadium on Friday. 
					The contest was divided into the movie art, stage art and art education groups. They competed in football, basketball, volleyball, table-tennis, athletics, tug of war and other events.
					
					Among the spectators were Kim Ki Nam, secretary of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea, Minister of Culture Pak Chun Nam, Chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of the Unions of Literature and Arts An Tong Chun, officials concerned and officials, creators and artistes in the fields of culture and arts. 
					
					The players displayed their sports tactics, team spirit and fair play in each event. 
					
					The stage art group placed first in total points.

articles.title: Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Communications Held
articles.content:
Scientific and Technological Presentation in Field of Communications Held 
 Hamhung, November 6 (KCNA) -- A national scientific and technological presentation in the field of communications took place in Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province from November 2 to 6. 
					 Present there were officials, scientists, technicians and teachers of Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and different units in the field of communications.
					
					 Presented there were valuable papers on successes and experience gained in the field of communications science and technology.
					
					 The participants introduced successes and experience gained in the work to develop communications of the country and exchanged views on the issues arising in applying them to practice.
					
					 A lecture on the trend of scientific and technological development in the field of communications was given during the presentation.

articles.title: French Business People Delegation Leaves
articles.content:
French Business People Delegation Leaves
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A delegation of French business people led by Alban Yung, Chinese representative of the "Foundation of Victor Segalen" in France, left here Friday.

articles.title: Gold Medalist at 46th Artistic Gymnastics World Championships Feted
articles.content:
Gold Medalist at 46th Artistic Gymnastics World Championships Feted
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK Cabinet Friday hosted a reception at Okryu Restaurant in honor of Ri Se Gwang, who bagged a gold medal at the 46th Artistic Gymnastics World Championships. 
					 Present there were Kim Yong Jin, vice-premier of the Cabinet; Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports; Ri Jong Mu, general of the Korean People's Army; officials concerned, players, coaches and their family members.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin, in a speech congratulated Ri Se Gwang on making the DPRK's flag hoisted in the championships, pleasing Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 Ri Se Gwang could win a gold medal at the championships entirely thanks to Kim Jong Un who showed deep loving care for the sportspersons, he said. 
					
					 He called upon all the sportspersons to exalt the honor of the country in all international games. 
					
					 Ri Se Gwang in his reply speech renewed his will to fully display the spirit and honor of the country in international games.

articles.title: New Books Published in DPRK
articles.content:
New Books Published in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- New books were recently published in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 They include "Respected Comrade Kim Jong Un, the Distinguished Genius of Literature and Arts in the Era of Songun", printed by the Social Science Book Publishing House, and "Battlefields Recorded in History", a book on common sense of history brought out by the Kumsong Youth Publishing House.
					
					 There are also "The U.S. Invasion of Korea" showing the crimes committed by the U.S. imperialists against the Korean nation and a book dealing with standard Korean, printed by the Science and Encyclopedia Publishing House, and "Diet and Health" published by the Health Education Institute.

articles.title: Recycling of Plastic Waste in DPRK
articles.content:
Recycling of Plastic Waste in DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Big efforts are paid to the recycling of industrial waste in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 The Kaesong Building-materials Cooperative developed a technique of making liquid fuel, black color and organic solvent from plastic waste. It localized all additives necessary for recycling.
					
					 This technique helps turn one ton of plastic waste into 400-500 kilograms of liquid fuel.
					
					 It won a gold medal at the National Inventions and New Technologies in July.

articles.title: WPK's Three-point Strategy
articles.content:
WPK's Three-point Strategy
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, clarified the three-point strategy of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), which attaches importance to the people, to the army and to the young people, in his speech made at the military parade and public procession of Pyongyang citizens to celebrate the 70th anniversary of the WPK.
					 The strategy of attaching importance to the people is based on the idea of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il which suggests believing in the people as in Heaven. It was their lifelong motto and creed that if one believes in the people and relies on them at all times, one will always emerge victorious and the popular masses are the most almighty being.
					
					 They always found themselves among the people and devoted their all to the happiness and wellbeing of people.
					
					 The strategy of attaching importance to the army is based on the idea of Songun (army-first) revolution which was pioneered and developed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Under the banner of Songun, Kim Il Sung led two revolutionary wars against the imperialists to victory and gave wise leadership to accomplishing the two-stage social revolution and socialist construction.
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed the Korean People's Army (KPA) into the army for the party and the leader and put forward the KPA as the driving force of the revolution, winning victory after victory in the confrontation with the U.S.
					
					 The strategy of attaching importance to the young people is based on the idea of giving priority to them set forth and held fast to by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, which has inspired them to great feats.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Opening Epochal Phase in Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Opening Epochal Phase in Inter-Korean Relations 
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Now an atmosphere of reconciliation and cooperation has been created in the inter-Korean relations. It is the time for the north and the south to pool their efforts and wisdom to open an epoch-making phase for great change in the north-south relations, Rodong Sinmun Friday says in an article. 
					 The article goes on:
					
					 Whether the north-south relations improve or not depends on what attitude the north and the south have and how they approach the problem. 
					
					 The improvement of the inter-Korean relations is not for the interests of one side but for interests common to the Korean nation and its unified development and co-prosperity. The historical truth is that the north-south relations will never improve by one-side's efforts only. The north and the south should try to improve the inter-Korean relations with the sincere stand and attitude of solving the reunification issue, hand-in-hand, in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself. They should not chill the atmosphere nor lay an artificial obstacle in the way of improving the relations. 
					
					 Now the inter-Korean relations develop step by step while tiding over difficulties thanks to the ardent enthusiasm of Koreans aspiring after reconciliation and cooperation, although there are challenges. 
					
					 The problem is the maneuvers of dishonest forces displeased with north-south dialogue and improvement of the inter-Korean relations and the bad habit of the south Korean authorities slandering the dialogue partner and resorting to confrontation moves, while calling for dialogue outwardly. 
					
					 It is illogical to have trustworthy dialogue between the north and the south for improvement of the relations amid confrontation rackets against the fellow countrymen in the north. 
					
					 If they positively respond to expectation and trust of all Koreans with patriotic and bold decision there would be an excellent fruition of great change in the inter-Korean relations.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japanese Reactionaries of Their Visits to Yasukuni Shrine
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Japanese Reactionaries of Their Visits to Yasukuni Shrine
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- Ultra right-wing politicians of Japan visited Yasukuni Shrine in group on the occasion of the autumn memorial service.
					 The present chief executive was the first to make ritual offering to the shrine. He was followed by the minister of Health, Labor and Welfare, the speaker of the House of Representatives and the president of the House of Councillors.
					
					 Not content with the offering, the minister of Internal Affairs, the minister of Justice and others personally visited the shrine. In the closing days of the service about 70 lawmakers affiliated to "the Association of Dietmen for Visiting Yasukuni Shrine" swarmed to stage a ritual there.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Friday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 Their visits to the shrine are an undisguised insult to the Asian people who suffered unspeakable disasters, pain and misfortune at the hands of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 This is, at the same time, an impudent act of the descendants of Samurais working hard to call back the departed soul of the militarists in a bid to realize their wild ambition for reinvasion, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 There is an increasing number of Japanese poisoned by militarism advocated by the shrine.
					
					 It is not far off when Japan would launch reinvasion under the pretext of "international cooperation" and "international contribution."
					
					 The Japanese ruling quarters should be mindful that their reinvasion would lead Japan to ruin.
					
					 They had better make an honest apology and redeem the past crimes as early as possible, not being hell-bent on the revival of militarism and reinvasion.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Representative of "Saenuri Party" of His Reckless Remarks against DPRK
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Representative of "Saenuri Party" of His Reckless Remarks against DPRK
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- On Nov. 2 Kim Mu Song, representative of the "Saenuri Party" of south Korea, in the "National Assembly" (NA) imprudently came up with the rumor of "collapse" of the DPRK linking it with a country in Europe where socialism collapsed in the 1990s. He went the lengths of letting loose such invectives that it is not long before unification would be achieved.
					 Minju Joson Friday says in a commentary:
					
					 What he uttered is sparking off public sarcasm as his "prediction" is not worth consideration, a proof of the height of his ignorance, because he is ill-famed for his narrow mind and lack of any ability to judge reality.
					
					 His sophism not only betrays his ignorance but glaringly reveals what is going on in south Korea where only a confrontation maniac can please the U.S. master and conservative ruling quarters, to say nothing of the "president."
					
					 By origin Kim is a die-hard pro-U.S. lackey as he is a descendant of a family of sycophants ill-famed for acts of treachery.
					
					 A litany of invectives let loose by Kim at the NA over the prospect of the DPRK is aimed to please the U.S. master racking its brain to save his hostile policy towards the DPRK from its total failure and win "presidency" in the next presidential election come what may with his backing. 
					
					 However, no one would pay heed to the barking of a rabid dog.
					
					 He would be well advised to drop a pipedream. No matter what malignant remarks he may make against the DPRK, Korean-style socialism remains undeterred. Those who turn their backs on the nation are always fated to meet a miserable doom.
					
					 Kim had better not forget the adage that his short tongue can put his long neck at stake.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Their Humiliating Diplomacy
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Their Humiliating Diplomacy
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Ulsan Solidarity for Progress of south Korea held a press conference near the building of the Ulsan City Office on Nov. 2 in protest against the authorities' humiliating diplomacy, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 The organization slammed Japan for preparing a war and undisguisedly reviving militarism after possessing an army under the pretext of the exercise of the "right to collective self-defense", far from making apology and reparation for the past crimes such as sexual slavery and forcible drafting.
					
					 Japan is disclosing its ambition for reinvasion against the Korean Peninsula without hesitation, it noted, adding that the present "government" is conducting humiliating diplomacy towards Japan, indifferent to the pain of the people.
					
					 It urged Japan to pay heed to the voices of the victims and opt for the settlement of its past crimes at an early date.

articles.title: S. Korean Organizations Call for Checking Introduction of "State-compiled" History Textbook
articles.content:
S. Korean Organizations Call for Checking Introduction of "State-compiled" History Textbook
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- South Korean organizations of different circles including the Network for Checking "State-compiled" Textbook held a meeting at Seoul University on Oct. 31 to denounce the authorities for moving to introduce "state-compiled" history textbook, according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 The speakers said that the introduction of the textbook pushed forward by the present regime and the "Saenuri Party" is by no means for people's unity.
					
					 They called on the students to wage a dynamic struggle to check the introduction of "state-compiled" history textbook just as they took the lead in the movement for democracy in the past.

articles.title: Respiratory Epidemic Spreads in South Korea
articles.content:
Respiratory Epidemic Spreads in South Korea
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- A respiratory epidemic dramatically spread in south Korea, arousing great concern, according to MBC and KBS of south Korea.
					 The epidemic with symptoms of pneumonia was reported to occur at Konkuk University on Oct. 19.
					
					 Three postgraduates complained of the symptoms of pneumonia after using a lab in a college of the university and their number increased to 21 just a few days later.
					
					 The number of the persons infected with the disease reportedly reached 52 as of Nov. 2.
					
					 The cause of infection remains unknown.

articles.title: U.S.-S. Korea War Confab Slammed
articles.content:
U.S.-S. Korea War Confab Slammed
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Citizens Solidarity for Democratic Society of south Korea made public a commentary on Nov. 3 in denunciation of the war confab between the U.S. and the south Korean warmongers.
					 The commentary accused the south Korean and U.S. military authorities of releasing a joint statement at an annual security consultative meeting in Seoul on Nov. 2.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issues of boosting military strategy for offensive against the north such as "4D operation conception" and tightening military cooperation among south Korea, the U.S. and Japan while shelving such serious issue as the case of introduction of anthrax, it noted, adding:
					
					 This is designed to escalate the military tension on the Korean Peninsula. 
					
					 "4D operation conception" is a dangerous war scenario for sparking not only accidental military clash but all-out war on the peninsula as it developed the "tailored deterrence strategy" into a military operation for mounting a preemptive attack on the north.
					
					 The decision made at the confab to boost the military cooperation and expand its sphere worldwide is aimed to back Japan's moves to scrap its Pacifist Constitution and exercise the "right to collective self-defense."
					
					 Dependence on the U.S. nuclear force aimed at intensified military strategy for offensive would never help denuclearize the Korean Peninsula but spark off arms race.

articles.title: "State-compiled" History Textbooks to Be Introduced despite Public Opposition in S. Korea
articles.content:
"State-compiled" History Textbooks to Be Introduced despite Public Opposition in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean regime announced on Nov. 3 the system of publishing "state-compiled" history textbooks for middle and high schools despite the public opposition at home and abroad, according to south Korean KBS.
					 The "prime minister" and minister of Education referred to the "inevitable introduction of the system and the "Saenuri Party" is zealously supporting it.
					
					 Textbooks had been published under the screening system in south Korea.
					
					 The regime-sponsored introduction of the "state-compiled" textbooks was prompted by the ulterior design of the conservative ruling forces to embellish sycophancy and treachery and dictatorship and incite confrontation with the compatriots in the north.
					
					 People of various circles have demanded retraction of the introduction plan, terming it a "history coup" and "revival of yusin" but the regime turned a deaf ear to their voices and announced the introduction.
					
					 The south Korean regime would be well advised to lend an ear to public voices, well aware of the baneful consequences to be entailed by the serious act of reviving at any cost the system dating back to the period of the "yusin" dictatorship.

articles.title: Shacking Agreement for U.S. Interests Rejected by S. Korean Body
articles.content:
Shacking Agreement for U.S. Interests Rejected by S. Korean Body
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference on Nov. 3 denouncing a war confab between the U.S. and south Korean authorities.
					 The organization recalled that the south Korean and U.S. military authorities agreed on guidelines for carrying out "4D operation concept" at an annual security consultative meeting on Nov. 2.
					
					 The contents of the agreement were peppered with points meeting the interests of the U.S. only, it charged.
					
					 All these are attributable to the unequal relations and alliance with the U.S. and only when they are scrapped, is it possible to protect the interests of the Korean nation, it noted.

articles.title: Decision of Political Bureau of C.C., WPK Supported by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Decision of Political Bureau of C.C., WPK Supported by Swiss Organizations
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on Oct. 30 in support of "On convening the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea", a decision adopted by the Political Bureau of its Central Committee.
					 The statement said:
					
					 The Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee adopted the historic decision on convening the 7th congress of the party in early May, Juche 105 (2016).
					
					 The WPK has firmly ensured the oneness and continuity of the idea and guidance of the leader and defended and maintained the party's cohesion and unity and successfully played a role of the organizer and guide of all victories of the Korean people for the past seven decades.
					
					 The decision of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee has a great historic significance.
					
					 The congress will make the DPRK more brilliantly shine as the beacon of world socialism.
					
					 It will give dynamic impetus to reconstruction of world socialism.
					
					 It will be an important landmark for realizing the DPRK's cause of building a thriving nation and more brilliantly illuminate the future of the Korean people.

articles.title: Mirae Scientists Street of DPRK Introduced in DR Congo
articles.content:
Mirae Scientists Street of DPRK Introduced in DR Congo
 Pyongyang, November 6 (KCNA) -- The National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo posted on its website an article and photos introducing Mirae Scientists Street, which was successfully completed as befitted the appearance of a highly civilized socialist nation, on Oct. 22.
					 The article said:
					
					 While the DPRK is enjoying a period of great prosperity in construction, Mirae Scientists Street has been newly built on the bank of the River Taedong in Pyongyang.
					
					 The street with apartment houses for thousands of families and over 150 welfare service facilities is a gift, which the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) presented to the teachers and scientists on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the founding of the WPK.
					
					 The street, which stands impeccable in any aspect, is associated with warm love of Marshal Kim Jong Un who gives top priority to the promotion of people's well-being, values highly the teachers and scientists as genuine patriots and revolutionaries and always pays great attention to developing science and technology of the country.
					
					 The looks of Pyongyang, the picturesque capital, have undergone further change as the street was completed.

articles.title: Problema de esclavitud sexual debe ser solucionado en esfera de toda Corea, insiste MINREX de RPDC
articles.content:
Problema de esclavitud sexual debe ser solucionado en esfera de toda Corea, insiste MINREX de RPDC 
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- A la pregunta de un reportero de la ACNC formulada en relacion con que Japon y el Sur de Corea acordaron esforzarse por la solucion rapida del problema de "consoladoras para el ejercito japones", el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio el dia 5 la siguiente respuesta:
					Segun trascendidos, en la cumbre Japon-Sur de Corea efectuada a principios de noviembre en Seul, se acordaron "acelerar" la consulta para resolver de manera pronta el problema de "consoladoras para el ejercito japones".
					
					Como ya sabe todo el mundo, el crimen de esclavitud sexual del ejercito japones perpetrado de manera organizativa por el Estado de Japon en el periodo de la ocupacion del imperialismo japones a Corea y la Segunda Guerra Mundial es uno de los crimenes a ser liquidados sin falta siendo el avieso delito imprescriptible de violacion de DDHH de categoria especial que pisoteo totalmente la dignidad, la castidad conyugal y el cuerpo de la mujer. 
					
					Durante su ocupacion a Corea en mas de 40 anos del siglo pasado, los imperialistas japoneses perpetraron los crimenes sin precedentes entre otros el arresto forzoso de mas de 8 millones 400 mil habitantes, asesinato de mas de un millon, la esclavitud sexual de 200 mil mujeres, "cambio de nombres y apellidos coreanos con los japoneses" y la prueba en el hombre vivo", pero ha venido evitando su liquidacion aun despues de 70 anos tras su derrota.
					
					El crimen mas barbaro y maligno no puede ser solucionado facilmente solo con una parte de las victimas.
					
					Las victimas de la esclavitud sexual estan no solo en el Sur, sino tambien en el Norte de la Peninsula Coreana, razon por la cual este problema no puede ser solucionado definitivamente, si no se tratan en la esfera de toda Corea los danos de toda nacion coreana.
					
					Japon debe reconocer la responsabilidad estatal por sus crimenes de esclavitud sexual del ex ejercito japones y otros crimenes antieticos y danos de gran tamano perpetrados contra el pueblo coreano e indemnizarlos cuanto antes para que acepte toda la nacion coreana.

articles.title: Entidad coreana exige a Japon tomar posicion correcta sobre problema de esclavitud sexual
articles.content:
Entidad coreana exige a Japon tomar posicion correcta sobre problema de esclavitud sexual
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Segun trascendidos, el premier japones Abe acordo hace poco en Seul con la mandataria del Sur de Corea "acelerar" las negociaciones para el "arreglo pronto del problema de consoladoras para el viejo ejercito japones".
					Al informarse de esta noticia, las victimas de esclavitud sexual para el ejercito japones existentes en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea estan muy indignadas y las otras radicadas en los paises asiaticos y las entidades  concernientes alzan las voces de censura.
					
					El portavoz del Comite Coreano por Medidas sobre el Problema de ex Esclavas Sexuales para el Ejercito Japones y Victimas de Reclutamiento Forzoso publico el dia 6 una declaracion como sigue:
					
					Las autoridades japonesas, en vez de evitar las responsabilidades historicas y estatales sobre el problema en cuestion, deben tomar parte en la solucion del caso con la actitud sincera y responsable para que todas las victimas del mundo lo consientan.
					
					Hasta la fecha, muchas victimas sobreviven en la RPDC, China, Filipinas, Indonesia y otros paises asiaticos danados y hasta en Holanda, las cuales demandan fuertemente al gobierno japones tomar las medidas para recuperar sus honores pisoteados al pedir disculpa e indemnizar sobre sus crimenes de esclavitud sexual.
					
					Sin embargo, los mandatarios de los dos paises "acordaron" el "arreglo pronto" del problema, lo que es un comportamiento irrazonable que desprecia y evita el verdadero aspecto del caso.
					
					El problema de esclavitud sexual, crimen antietico internacional, no es el regateo para el interes politico de alguien ni el problema a ser solucionado con el metodo de persuadir tal o cual metodo a las autoridades surcoreanas.
					
					Para solucionar el problema, el culpable Japon debe reconocer las responsabilidades estatales y legales sobre el crimen, pedir disculpa sincera por el respecto a todas las victimas de varios paises y regiones del mundo y a sus familias y prometer ante la sociedad internacional no cometer mas tales crimenes a traves de los actos practicos dando a conocerlo correctamente en la educacion de la historia.
					
					Hoy en dia, el problema de esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito japones constituye un asunto internacional a ser solucionado sin falta para poner fin a la violencia sexual y establecer el valor universal de DDHH en el mundo.
					
					Lo comprueba el hecho de que en el Consejo de Derechos Humanos de la ONU y otras organizaciones internacionales y en las asambleas nacionales de diversos paises del planeta se adoptan recomendaciones y resoluciones en demanda de la solucion imparcial del problema de esclavitud sexual para el viejo ejercito japones y se edifican las estatuas que simbolizan a las victimas de este crimen. 
					
					Las autoridades japonesas deben tener presente que solo cuando tomen las sinceras y responsables medidas de solucion sobre todos los crimenes antieticos del pasado, incluso el problema de esclavitud sexual, pueden establecer las relaciones de verdadera confianza con la sociedad internacional y contribuir a la armonia y estabilidad de la region.

articles.title: Consejo de Ministros de RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de gimnasta Ri Se Gwang
articles.content:
Consejo de Ministros de RPDC ofrece banquete en honor de gimnasta Ri Se Gwang
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- El Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio el dia 6 en el Restaurante Okryu un banquete en honor de Ri Se Gwang, ganador del 46o Campeonato Mundial de Gimnasia de Aparatos.
					En la recepcion participaron el vicepremier Kim Yong Jin, el ministro de Deportes Kim Yong Hun, el general del Ejercito Popular de Corea Ri Jong Mu, y otros funcionarios de la rama interesada, los deportistas, entrenadores y los familiares de Ri.
					
					El vicepremier Kim Yong Jin pronuncio un discurso.
					
					El orador felicito al ganador de medalla de oro quien dio alegria al Mariscal Kim Jong Un e izo la bandera nacional.
					
					Enfatizo que el presente exito es el fruto de la direccion del Mariscal quien dispensa todas las benevolencias a los deportistas.
					
					Subrayo que todos los deportistas deben demostrar a todo el mundo el honor de la patria en las competencias internacionales.
					
					En sus palabras de respuesta, Ri Se Gwang expreso su decision de exaltar mas el impetu y honor de la patria en los juegos internacionales.

articles.title: Efectuada 46a competencia deportiva de artistas
articles.content:
Efectuada 46a competencia deportiva de artistas 
Pyongyang, 6 de noviembre (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar el dia 6 en el Estadio Kim Il Sung la 46a competencia deportiva de artistas.
					En el torneo dividido en las ramas de cinematografia, arte escenica y educacion artistica, se realizaron los partidos de futbol, baloncesto, voleibol, tenis de mesa, atletismo, lucha de cuerda y otras disciplinas.
					
					Los vieron el secretario del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Kim Ki Nam, el ministro de Cultura Pak Chun Nam, el presidente del Comite Central de la Federacion General de Escritores y Artistas de Corea An Tong Chun, los funcionarios interesados y los funcionarios, creadores y artistas de la rama de cultura y arte. 
					
					Los jugadores demostraron bien sus tecnicas deportivas, el espiritu colectivista y nobles rasgos morales. 
					
					El sector de arte escenica ocupo el primer lugar en clasificacion general.
